intro: Borinda schmidiana, commonly known as the Schmidian borinda, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a glossy appearance. Borinda schmidiana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blossoms.
